medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until approximately 8 months before presentation, when she noted shortness of breath while jogging her usual 4 miles. Symptoms gradually worsened over the next 7 months, leading to becoming winded within 7 minutes of jogging or climbing stairs, accompanied by leg fatigue. No aggravating or relieving factors specified.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Osteopenia, migraine headaches, hyperlipidemia, seasonal allergies, intermittent mildly elevated aminotransferase levels, and excision of an adenomatous colonic polyp 2 years ago. Sinus surgery and tonsillectomy in the distant past.
medical_history.family_history: Father had cardiac arrhythmias. Sister with breast cancer, another sister possibly had systemic lupus erythematosus. Brother had type 1 diabetes mellitus. One child had diabetes mellitus and another had a supraventricular arrhythmia.
medical_history.social_history: Worked in an office. Drank wine occasionally, stopped smoking 30 years ago (after 3 years of smoking), did not use illicit drugs. Exercises daily by walking and jogging 4 miles.
